scenario:
Meta Platforms, Advanced Micro Devices, and ServiceNow are considered promising long-term investments due to their wide moats, reliable growth rates, and reasonable valuations. 

Meta Platforms, the world's largest social media company, served 3.29 billion monthly active users in 2024's third quarter, up 5% from a year earlier. Analysts expect its revenue and earnings to grow by 21% and 52%, respectively, in 2024, and by 15% and 12%, respectively, in 2025. Its stock trades at 24 times forward earnings.

Advanced Micro Devices, the world's second-largest producer of x86 CPUs and discrete GPUs, reported revenue and adjusted earnings growth of 13% and 26%, respectively, in 2024, and is expected to grow by 27% and 54%, respectively, in 2025. Its data center sales soared 122% year over year in its latest reported quarter, driven by robust demand for its Epyc CPUs and Instinct GPUs. The stock trades at 25 times forward earnings.

ServiceNow, a cloud-based services provider, reported revenue and adjusted earnings growth of 22% and 29%, respectively, in 2024, and is expected to grow by 21% and 19%, respectively, in 2025. Its stock trades at 64 times forward earnings, but its robust growth, sticky ecosystem, and heavy exposure to the booming AI market make it a promising long-term investment.
